PATIENT_ID: TEST_TBI_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-20 14:30:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-20 14:45:00
Patient arrived via EMS after motor vehicle collision.
Presence of suspected traumatic brain injury based on mechanism and decreased level of consciousness.
Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) on arrival: 12 (E3 V4 M5).

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-20 15:00:00
Post-resuscitation assessment completed. Patient adequately resuscitated with BP 120/80, HR 88.
Documentation confirming GCS assessed after adequate cardiopulmonary resuscitation: GCS reassessed: 13 (E4 V4 M5).
Location and timing of GCS assessment: Emergency Department.
GCS reflects post-resuscitation neurologic status.
CT brain ordered.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-20 15:45:00
CT BRAIN WITHOUT CONTRAST

FINDINGS:
Small right frontal contusion. No midline shift. No skull fracture identified.

IMPRESSION:
Confirmed traumatic brain injury with right frontal contusion.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-20 16:00:00
CT confirms TBI. Patient now GCS 14. GCS assessment occurred during initial Emergency Department evaluation.
Will admit to ICU for observation and serial neuro checks.
